pages.text:
MEETINGS & EVENTS Accomplish the Incredible Streamsong is a meeting and incentive destination intentionally designed in harmony with its natural surroundings and deeply committed to the highest aspirations of today‚Äôs business elite. Here you will experience an environment uniquely designed to spark innovation, fuel motivation and engage communication in ways you‚Äôve never imagined. From an intimate executive retreat to a grand gathering, Streamsong is a place to accomplish things of value and return renewed. The resort offers an inspirational, distraction-free environment with 25,000 sq. ft. of dedicated meeting space and 60,000 sq. ft. of dramatic outdoor venues. 12 large and small meeting rooms accommodate 10 to 500 in complete comfort and privacy. General session and breakout rooms are conveniently clustered for effective program flow. Experienced conference coordinators and onsite media services ensure every detail of your program is handled promptly and professionally. We understand truly great meetings are the ones that ignite an audience with the power to inspire, entertain and educate. Streamsong provides a distraction-free environment enabling you to take your message far beyond the four walls of a meeting room. Believe it. The right meeting can change your company forever. We know, Streamsong is now the preferred destination for many of today‚Äôs biggest, brightest and fastest growing organizations. Let us help you accomplish the incredible. Submit an RFP for more information. SUBMIT RFP RESORT MAP EVENT FACILITIES MEETING PLANNER GUIDE STREAMSONG STORY VIDEO
VENUES ARCHITECTS HALL Over 7500 sq. ft. of space with option to break into three separate rooms Architects Hall is the largest indoor function space at Streamsong complete with private entrance. Streamsong Black Clubhouse A private dining room as well as the option to reserve the entire clubhouse and the gauntlet putting course for special events and groups. SMALL MEETINGS Coore, Crenshaw, Hanse and Wagner are perfect for small group and executive retreat meetings combining to create 884 and 1350 sq. ft. respectively. Just steps from the Lodge lobby this flexible space can be broken into four small rooms or combined to make two larger venues. BOARD ROOMS Bordeaux and Toscana are located on the lower level of the Lodge and provide the perfect board meeting venue. At 844 and 750 sq. ft. respectively both rooms are wired for sound with flatscreen TVs and the latest in audio visual options. FACILITIES OVERVIEW LEARN MORE ABOUT OUR FACILITIES SERVICES WEDDINGS LEARN MORE ABOUT WEDDINGS CONTACT SALES TEAM ANDREA SMITH Director of Group Sales 863.344.1471 Florida:¬† Northeast US: West Coast [email¬†protected] Andrea Smith, Director of Group Sales, joined the Streamsong Resort in December, 2014. Prior to Streamsong, Andrea was a Sales Leader at the Sawgrass Marriott Golf Resort & Spa for 18 years. As a team leader at Streamsong, Andrea is able to build unique group experiences in a one of a kind destination. EMAIL JESSICA CANNON Senior Sales Manager 813.955.6372 Florida:¬† South East US:¬† North East and South East [email¬†protected] Jessica Cannon joined the Streamsong Sales Team in 2018 after years of experience with Omni Hotels.¬† Jessica is based in GA. Although her career started in catering, she has been working with groups now for over 18 years. Jessica is responsible for corporate groups with a special focus on the Financial and Insurance markets. EMAIL MICHELLE LEWIS Senior Sales Manager 863.344.0627 Florida:¬† Central and West Coast US:¬† Mid West and Mid Atlantic [email¬†protected] Michelle joined Streamsong with over 15 years of sales experience. Michelle previously held the positions of National Sales Manager at Innisbrook Resort and InterContinental Tampa. She achieved numerous accolades including Chairmen‚Äôs Club, President‚Äôs Club, and Manager of the Year recognition. A graduate of Indiana University of Pennsylvania. EMAIL Christina Wiedersheim VIP Services & Events Manager 863.312.6007 [email¬†protected] Christina has over 25 years of experience in the hospitality industry, including sales, catering, and event management. She gained valuable experience with several Marriott and Ritz-Carlton Resorts in Florida, as well as the Waldorf Astoria Resort in Orlando. Christina joined the Streamsong team in 2012. EMAIL STAY CONNECTED Facebook Instagram Twitter YouTube Where Streamsong Red & Blue cross paths üëã Streamsong Red. ABOUT STREAMSONG Seas of Change Many millions of years ago, land that is now Streamsong Resort was covered by oceans and exposed land, home to both giant earth and sea creatures. Thick forests and grassy plains provided refuge for shovel-tusked mastodons, hornless rhinos, humpless camels and 30-foot crocodiles. Warm waters surrounding the area were filled with a rich variety of prehistoric marine life, including the notorious and now extinct giant shark, Megalodon like the one displayed in the Resort‚Äôs Lobby. Glacial activity caused the oceans to rise and fall again and again over a 50 million year period. At times, Florida was twice its current width. At other times it was less than 100 miles long and 10 miles wide. Man‚Äôs activities here trace to early Indian tribes living in native villages throughout the region. Hernando DeSoto and his army camped on this property in 1539. Early settlers endured incredible hardships to tame Central Florida‚Äôs vast, wild lands for ranching and farming. Their story is chronicled in the award-winning novel, A Land Remembered, which is found in every guest room of Streamsong Lodge . It‚Äôs in our Bones In the late 1800s came the discovery of massive phosphate rock deposits that had formed 10 to 15 million years earlier when the oceans receded and the remains of sea life settled into the deep sediment layers that were left behind. An industry was thus born that would become the economic backbone of Central Florida for more than a century. Fossils discovered in the phosphate mines of Florida have revealed much about the history of the land. They tell us that many species of mammals came to tropical and sub-tropical Florida forests from other parts of the world to escape the advancing glaciers of the great ‚ÄúIce Ages.‚Äù Thanks to the unique geological characteristics of this phosphate-rich region, most of the fossils are beautifully preserved, with amazing detail and color. To this day, the land surrounding Streamsong is known as the Bone Valley region of Florida. Streamsong Today The Mosaic Company, founders of Streamsong, sought ways to further enhance the land it reclaimed after mining and to support the communities where it operated.¬† In 2012 Mosaic embarked on an innovative development opportunity called Streamsong as a prototype for post‚Äêmining economic and environmental sustainability. Moving from one land use to another, Streamsong showcases how reclaimed land can be commercially developed in an environmentally responsible manner, while also becoming an economic driver for rural areas. Since opening experienced biologists, botanists, environmental engineers and committed hospitality professionals have done more than just reclaim this formally mined land; they have improved it. A bold vision that started just over a decade ago now helps support the local economy creating over 450 hospitality-related jobs, and protecting the land, water and wildlife ‚Äì all paramount to the resort‚Äôs ongoing operation, now owned and operated by KemperSports. Streamsong is a place where individuals and organizations can accomplish things of value and return renewed. The transformation of this unique landscape gave rise to a one-of-a-kind golf destination now known around the world as a place so aptly named ‚Äì Streamsong. No highways, no houses or condos, no obstructed sunrises or sunsets. Just the sights and sounds, the flora and fauna, the water and wind of natural Florida.
LOCATION Finding your way to Streamsong¬Æ is easier and closer than you think. Our luxury accommodations, three renowned golf courses‚ÄîStreamsong¬Æ Blue, Streamsong¬Æ Red, and Streamsong¬Æ Black are located within 90 minutes of both Tampa and Orlando and 30 minutes south of Lakeland in Central Florida. GET DIRECTIONS GET DIRECTIONS FROM AIRPORTS COMPANY JOIN OUR TEAM STAY CONNECTED Facebook Instagram Twitter YouTube Where Streamsong Red & Blue cross paths üëã Streamsong Red. Management TEAM Thank you for your interest in Streamsong, the premier golf resort in Central Florida . We are pleased to provide you with the assistance and information you require. Should you wish to speak with someone directly in regards to Streamsong golf, accommodations, and other resort facilities , our contact directory can help you find the answers to your questions.

STREAMSONG BLUE ‚ÄúThis is such a good piece of land for golf. The variety of contours created by the mining process is unique for a project in Florida‚Äìor anywhere in the Southeast.‚Äù -Tom Doak, Architect, Streamsong Blue With its multiple elevation changes, fairways navigating wild grasses and deep-water ponds and huge bunkers that roll off of towering sand dunes, Streamsong Blue seems designed by discovery rather than by intention. Created by Renaissance Golf Design‚Äôs renowned architect Tom Doak‚Äìwho already has four designs ranked among the top 100 in the world ‚ÄìStreamsong Blue has been equally well received. Streamsong Blue features spectacular terrain, with rises and falls in elevation, and contours that undulate offering some of the most stimulating holes in golf. View Streamsong Blue Course Flyover View Streamsong Blue Scorecard The Streamsong Blue Megalodon logo pays tribute to the giant shark that roamed the deep blue seas many millions of years ago when the area where Streamsong Resort lies was covered by oceans. Look closely during your next round and you might find your own shark tooth in the native areas surrounding the¬†course. AWARDS ‚Ä¢ Golf Digest ‚Äì America‚Äôs 100 Greatest Public Courses #26 ‚Äì Streamsong Blue (2025) ‚Ä¢ Golfweek ‚Äì Top 100 Courses You Can Play #26 ‚Äì Streamsong Blue (2025) ‚Ä¢ Golfweek ‚Äì Best You Can Play in Florida #3 ‚Äì Streamsong Blue (2024) ‚Ä¢ Golfweek ‚Äì Top 200 Resort Courses #19 ‚Äì Streamsong Blue (2023) ‚Ä¢ Golfweek ‚Äì Top 200 Modern Courses in the U.S. #53 ‚Äì Streamsong Blue (2024) ‚Ä¢ GOLF Magazine ‚Äì Top 100 Courses You Can Play #19 ‚Äì Streamsong Blue (2024)

Short Course ‚ÄúAlthough diminutive in size, we believe The Chain, when combined with the anything-but-diminutive Bucket putting course, has the potential to complement, perhaps even enhance, Streamsong's reputation for must-be-experienced golf .‚Äù - Bill Coore, Course Architect, The Chain and Streamsong Red "There are all sorts of holes that are very unusual of shorter length, and the really good players will really enjoy it and say this is not like a pitch and putt, there's some real golf there. We think it's going to be a great amenity and people will enjoy it too. - Ben Crenshaw, Course Architect, The Chain and Streamsong Red Streamsong‚Äôs fourth course, The Chain, is now open for play on all 19 holes. Be sure to experience The Chain when you book your upcoming trip to Streamsong View The Chain Flyover View The Chain Scorecard The Chain is designed to dial up the fun factor for Streamsong guests, with match play and walking at the heart of the experience.¬† Each hole has teeing areas (instead of tee markers) with dragline chains (the course namesake) in the ground to mark the beginning and end of each teeing area.¬† Guests choose where they‚Äôd like to play each hole in a match play format with the winner of each hole choosing the tee location on the following hole.¬† The scorecard has no reference to par although most of the holes are one shot holes with a range of yardages from 109 ‚Äì 293 from the farthest teeing area.¬† The course includes a six hole loop that plays around a grove of Oaks with holes that vary in length from 110 ‚Äì 153 yards from the farthest teeing areas or as short as 50 ‚Äì 88 yards from the most forward teeing area.¬† From the six hole loop, guests venture into the 13 hole loop where holes measure up to 293 yards with more forced carries in play depending on the tee you choose. The team from Coore and Crenshaw Design have created another masterpiece on the roughly 36 acre site taking advantage of every opportunity to showcase the unexpected elevation changes and live oak groves, water features, and sandscapes throughout to create a compelling layout. The legendary duo also designed Streamsong Red , which opened in 2012 with ‚ÄúBest New U.S. Course‚Äù honors and is perennially ranked among the top 30 courses in the U.S. by Golf Digest, Golf Magazine and Golfweek. The Bucket , a two and a half acre putting course that is part of the new concept also steps from the Lodge entrance, is open for resort guest play daily at noon. Tee times for 19 holes only; 6 and 13 hole loops are on a walk up basis. Large dragline chain links similar to those used in the mining process on the Streamsong site mark the beginning and end of each tee box, however specified tee markers and a score relative to par are thoughtfully and purposefully absent from the concept. Marking the middle of the site (and The Bucket putting course) is a 22,000 pound dragline bucket as a constant reminder of the history of its location. The Chain Hole in One Hall of Fame Golf.com ‚Äì Why you won‚Äôt want to miss Streamsong‚Äôs new 19-hole short course

Marking the middle of the site (and The Bucket putting course) is a 22,000 pound dragline bucket as a constant reminder of the history of its location. STREAMSONG RED ‚Äú...some of the most unusual, interesting and dramatic land forms we have ever encountered...the landscape is different than anything we‚Äôve ever worked with.‚Äù - Bill Coore, Architect, Streamsong Red Simply put, Streamsong Red is like nothing you‚Äôve ever played. Designed by the legendary team of Bill Coore and Ben Crenshaw‚Äìarchitects of seven designs in the Top 100 in the United States‚Äì Streamsong Red is an 18-hole masterpiece. Winding through decades-old sand dunes, lakes, and natural bunkers, Streamsong ‚Äúis naturally conducive to uncovering great golf holes,‚Äù says Crenshaw, who himself is a two-time Masters Champion. With its striking landforms, expansive lakes , rolling terrain and stretches of open savannah, Streamsong Red brings drama and strategy into play on each spectacular hole. View Streamsong Red Course Flyover View Streamsong Red Scorecard The Streamsong Red Locomotive logo honors the history that the railways served in transporting phosphate from this site for decades. Recently an 1880‚Äôs era steam engine was unearthed during a mining operation and now sits at the Mulberry Phosphate Museum for all to see. STREAMSONG BLACK ‚ÄúThe scale and shape of this landscape and the creative design features we were able to incorporate into this layout make Streamsong Black a fun and strategic course to play‚Äù. - Gil Hanse, Architect, Streamsong Black Golf Digest‚Äôs 2018 Best New Golf Course of the Year, Streamsong Black designed by acclaimed architect Gil Hanse is a dazzling Par-73 championship layout offering breathtaking views of the vast landscape, which includes flowing elevation, rolls, tumbles and sand ridges akin to the Sand Belt Region of Melbourne, Australia. This exciting new addition to Streamsong is big, bold and features The Gauntlet , a 1.2 acre putting course . Streamsong Black is the perfect complement to Streamsong Red and Streamsong Blue. View Streamsong Black Course Flyover View Streamsong Black Scorecard The iconic windmill that marks the aiming point to the ninth hole‚Äôs punchbowl green was incorporated into a unique type treatment to create the logo for Streamsong Black. Aim at the windmill from the ninth tee and you‚Äôll always find the fairway.
